results.title: Mulan
results.creator_credit: Pam Coats, Walt Disney Pictures, Barry Cook and Tony Bancroft
results.brief_description: A remarkable epic about honour, courage and the family spirit, Mulan chronicles the daring adventures of a young Chinese woman whose irrepressible spirit clashes with her tradition-bound society. When her country is forced into war by the invading Hun army, Mulan searches deep within herself, takes her ailing father’s conscription notice, and joins the Chinese army in order to save his life. Features the voices of Ming-Na Wen, Lea Salonga, Eddie Murphy, Miguel Ferrer, B.D. Wong and Donny Osmond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pam Coats, Walt Disney Pictures, Barry Cook and Tony Bancroft

results.title: Muhammad: legacy of a prophet [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kikim Media, Unity Productions Foundation, KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), Alexander Kronemer, Michael Wolfe, Michael Schwarz, Liz Gray and Omar Al-Qattan
results.brief_description: Born in the year 570 in Mecca, Arabia, his father having died before his birth, and his mother dying when he was only six, Muhammad, sheltered by a powerful uncle, made a good start in life, establishing himself in a profitable business and marrying well. And then, at the age of 40, he was transformed. A man who could not read or write, he announced that he was the prophet of God, and in the next 23 years he would bring peace to the warring pagan tribes of Arabia and establish the new religion of Islam, which today has 1.2 billion followers. With some of the world’s greatest scholars on Islam providing historical context and critical perspective, and through paintings, archival resources, ancient artefacts and re-enactments, this superb documentary film presents an in depth discourse on the life and legacy of the Prophet Muhammad - a story that has relied solely on oral history and the recorded word passed down from the 7th century because, unlike the figure of Jesus Christ in the Christian belief, there are no images of the Prophet Muhammad for he was not seen as a “divine” figure by his followers. Muhammad’s legacy brings us to today’s Muslims and the preconception, particularly by the West and especially since 9/11, that they are terrorists and fanatics. This program sets out to dispel the myths and misunderstandings by taking the viewer into the homes, mosques and work places of American Muslims (6-7 million in America, many who have immigrated from Iraq during the Gulf War) who openly talk of their faith, and their beliefs and values that shape their lives, commenting that fanaticism and acts of terrorism are contrary to the beliefs of Islam. Shot on location in the Middle East, Europe and the United States, this documentary program took three years to complete but the result is probably one of the most comprehensive chronicles produced on the life of the Prophet Muhammad and the Islamic religion. Narrated by Andre Braugher.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kikim Media, Unity Productions Foundation, KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.), Alexander Kronemer, Michael Wolfe, Michael Schwarz, Liz Gray and Omar Al-Qattan

results.title: Muhammad Ali: through the eyes of the world
results.creator_credit: TWI, Carlton Television, Louise Murray and Phil Grabsky
results.brief_description: Examines the life of boxer, athlete, civil rights champion and a compelling figure of the twentieth century - Muhammad Ali. Using extensive archival footage and stills, “Ali” presents numerous interviews with countless of his contemporaries who comment on Ali’s profile and personality, his impact in the media and on the incendiary times in America of the 1960s and 70s. Interviews include James Earl Jones, Billy Crystal, Rod Steiger, Billy Connolly, Tom Jones, BB King and Richard Harris (many acknowledging Ali’s skill as an entertainer), Ali’s family, trainer, childhood friends, journalists, historians, broadcasters and writers. Fellow boxers, including Cooper, Torres, Eubank, Ellis and Forman discuss Ali’s intimidating and peerless style. Contains exciting footage from the 1960 Olympics, and of Ali versus Liston (1964), Williams, Terrell (‘67), Frazier (‘71 and ‘74), Ellis (‘71), Foreman (74), Wepner (‘75) and Spinks (‘78). Also addresses Ali’s religious conversion to Islam, his involvement in the Civil Rights movement - when much of America was divided racially Ali introduced the notion that “black is beautiful” - the furore of his refusal to be drafted, his many marriages, post-boxing life and current roles. This work is really a celebration of Ali’s career - not just as a pugilist, but as a world figure.

results.title: Muhammad Ali: the whole story
results.creator_credit: Paul Doyle, Turner Home Entertainment and Time-Warner
results.brief_description: An in depth, six-part chronological document on one of the twentieth century’s greatest sportspersons, Muhammad Ali. Includes interviews with friends, foes and those that worked closely with him. Muhammad Ali himself, was a consultant for this series. Written by Gary Cohen. Narrated by Don Maseng.

results.title: Mugging: a case study in communication
results.creator_credit: Victor Lockwood and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Making Sense of Society”.
Looks at the press coverage of “mugging” to illustrate some points about the social nature of mass communications. Brings together and connects the two themes of communication and crime. Stuart Hall, of the University of Birmingham looks at and discusses these issues.

results.title: Muggers
results.creator_credit: AFFC, Winchester Films, Nigel Odell, David Redman and Dean Murphy
results.brief_description: A comedy that involves sex, surgery and golf - and a lighthearted look at the gruesome business of human organ trafficking. Two young medical students, Brad and Gregor (Matt Day, Jason Barry), find themselves in desperate times as they have no money to pay their fees, the rent or buy food. Mannah from heaven comes in the form of a man jumping to his death in front of them, providing the boys the means to steal his kidney and assist with their financial obligation to local gangster Roy Rogers (Chris Haywood). Roy also has a financial hold on fellow student Sophie (Petra Yared) who works as a prostitute to cover her student costs. In a bid to clear their own debt, and Sophie’s, Brad and Gregor get creative and steal more organs, upsetting the local corrupt ambulance officers who, up to that point, were the main suppliers. Cast includes Nicola Charles, Caroline Gillmer, Simon Bossell, Frank Gallacher.

results.title: Muffin by helicopter
results.brief_description: An episode of the children’s television show “Muffin the Mule” starring Annette Mills on piano and the puppets Muffin the Mule, Oswald the Ostrich, Grace the Giraffe and Peregrine Esq the Penguin. Muffin the Mule returns for a trip to France with a surpprise for Annette - a little giraffe called Grace.
